segment.source: How to turn Enteprrise Mode off temporarily while testing websites and how to turn it off completely if you no longer want to to use it.
segment.target: How to turn Enteprrise Mode off temporarily while testing websites and how to turn it off completely if you no longer want to to use it.

segment.source: Turn off Enterprise Mode (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Turn off Enterprise Mode (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Turn off Enterprise Mode
segment.target: Turn off Enterprise Mode

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: It’s important that you test the sites you’re adding, or considering removing, from your Enterprise Mode site list.
segment.target: It’s important that you test the sites you’re adding, or considering removing, from your Enterprise Mode site list.

segment.source: To make this testing easier, you can turn off the site list or the entire Enterprise Mode functionality.
segment.target: To make this testing easier, you can turn off the site list or the entire Enterprise Mode functionality.

segment.source: For example, you might have an intranet site on your list that you’ve upgraded to be compatible with the new web standards .
segment.target: For example, you might have an intranet site on your list that you’ve upgraded to be compatible with the new web standards .

segment.source: If you test the site while the site list is active, Internet Explorer 11 will automatically switch to Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: If you test the site while the site list is active, Internet Explorer 11 will automatically switch to Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: By turning off the site list, you can see what the page actually looks like and decide whether to remove it from your site list.
segment.target: By turning off the site list, you can see what the page actually looks like and decide whether to remove it from your site list.

segment.source: In addition, if you no longer want your users to be able to turn Enterprise Mode on locally, you can remove Enterprise Mode from the local Tools menu.
segment.target: In addition, if you no longer want your users to be able to turn Enterprise Mode on locally, you can remove Enterprise Mode from the local Tools menu.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Turning off both of these features turns off Enterprise Mode for your company.
segment.target: Turning off both of these features turns off Enterprise Mode for your company.

segment.source: Turning off Enterprise Mode also causes any websites included in your employee’s manual site lists to not appear in Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: Turning off Enterprise Mode also causes any websites included in your employee’s manual site lists to not appear in Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: To turn off the site list using Group Policy
segment.target: To turn off the site list using Group Policy

segment.source: Open your Group Policy editor, like Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: Open your Group Policy editor, like Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: Go to the Use the Enterprise Mode IE website list setting, and then click Disabled.
segment.target: Go to the Use the Enterprise Mode IE website list setting, and then click Disabled.

segment.source: Enterprise Mode will no longer look for the site list, effectively turning off Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: Enterprise Mode will no longer look for the site list, effectively turning off Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: However, if you previously turned on local control for your employees, Enterprise Mode will still be available from the Tools menu.
segment.target: However, if you previously turned on local control for your employees, Enterprise Mode will still be available from the Tools menu.

segment.source: You need to turn that part of the functionality off separately.
segment.target: You need to turn that part of the functionality off separately.

segment.source: To turn off local control using Group Policy
segment.target: To turn off local control using Group Policy

segment.source: Open your Group Policy editor, like Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: Open your Group Policy editor, like Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: Go to the Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting, and then click Disable.
segment.target: Go to the Let users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting, and then click Disable.

segment.source: Enterprise Mode no longer shows up on the Tools menu for your employees.
segment.target: Enterprise Mode no longer shows up on the Tools menu for your employees.

segment.source: However, if you are still using an Enterprise Mode site list, all of the globally listed sites will still appear in Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: However, if you are still using an Enterprise Mode site list, all of the globally listed sites will still appear in Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: If you want to turn off all of Enterprise Mode, you will need to also turn off the site list functionality.
segment.target: If you want to turn off all of Enterprise Mode, you will need to also turn off the site list functionality.

segment.source: To turn off the site list using the registry
segment.target: To turn off the site list using the registry

segment.source: Open a registry editor, such as regedit.exe.
segment.target: Open a registry editor, such as regedit.exe.

segment.source: Go to , and then delete the SiteList value.
segment.target: Go to , and then delete the SiteList value.

segment.source: You can also use HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, depending whether you want to turn off the Enterprise Mode site list for users or for computers.
segment.target: You can also use HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, depending whether you want to turn off the Enterprise Mode site list for users or for computers.

segment.source: Close all and restart all instances of Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Close all and restart all instances of Internet Explorer.

segment.source: IE11 stops looking at the site list for rendering instructions.
segment.target: IE11 stops looking at the site list for rendering instructions.

segment.source: However, Enterprise Mode is still available to your users locally (if it was turned on).
segment.target: However, Enterprise Mode is still available to your users locally (if it was turned on).

segment.source: To turn off local control using the registry
segment.target: To turn off local control using the registry

segment.source: Open a registry editor, such as regedit.exe.
segment.target: Open a registry editor, such as regedit.exe.

segment.source: Go , and then delete the Enable value.
segment.target: Go , and then delete the Enable value.

segment.source: You can also use HKEY_CURRENT_USER, depending whether you want to turn off Enterprise Mode for users or for computers.
segment.target: You can also use HKEY_CURRENT_USER, depending whether you want to turn off Enterprise Mode for users or for computers.

segment.source: Close and restart all instances of IE.
segment.target: Close and restart all instances of IE.

segment.source: Enterprise Mode is no longer a user option on the Tools menu in IE11.
segment.target: Enterprise Mode is no longer a user option on the Tools menu in IE11.

segment.source: However, IE11 still looks at the site list (if it was turned on).
segment.target: However, IE11 still looks at the site list (if it was turned on).
